text: David W. Harvey (born 31 October 1935) is a British-born Marxist economic geographer. He is a professor of anthropology and geography at the Graduate Center of the City University of New York (CUNY). He is known for his support of the idea of the right to the city. In 2007, Harvey was listed as the 18th most-cited author of books in the humanities and social sciences in that year. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:Living people Category:British anthropologists Category:British geographers Category:British economists Category:Marxists Category:Writers from Kent
title: David Harvey
